mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Morgan, George C.
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Wrote to Jefferson because Jefferson is friends with Morgan's uncle Dr. Price; brought letters for Guy Jean Baptiste Target and HonorÃ© Gabriel Riquetti, Comte de Mirabeau; his uncle and Lord Lansdowne want to know about "the state of things in this place" [Paris ?]; Dr. Price misses Jefferson; Morgan's friend, Mr. Dallas, alerted Morgan of the possibility that Jefferson would still be in Paris during Morgan's visit; hopes if Jefferson is not busy Morgan can see him; if not, Morgan will send any message from Jefferson to Dr. Price.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1789 July 11, "Grand hotel du Palais Royal cour des fontaines," [Paris, France], to [Thomas Jefferson], n.p.
